TERMS_content:
THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS (“TERMS”) APPLY TO EACH PROSPECTIVE PARTICIPANT IN THE SYMBOL PROJECT AND HOLDER OF XYM TOKENS (“XYM”). 

BY PARTICIPATING IN THE MIGRATION AND TOKENOMICS (AS DETAILED IN THE PROPOSAL PASSED BY NEM COMMUNITY ON 21 DECEMBER 2019), YOU WILL BE BOUND BY THESE TERMS AND BY ALL OF THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE. THESE TERMS, THEREFORE, ARE A BINDING CONTRACT BETWEEN YOU AND SYMBOL CHAIN LIMITED. 

PLEASE READ THESE TERMS CAREFULLY AND NOTE THAT THE SECTION ON DISPUTE RESOLUTION CONTAINS A BINDING JURISDICTION CLAUSE WHICH AFFECTS YOUR LEGAL RIGHTS. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THESE TERMS, DO NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE SYMBOL PROJECT. 


YOU AND THE COMPANY HEREBY AGREE AS FOLLOWS: 


1. Parties to these Terms 

1.1 SYMBOL CHAIN LIMITED, a company incorporated and registered in Gibraltar under number 120015 and with its registered address at Suite 7, Hadfield House, Library Street, Gibraltar, GX11 1AA (“Company”, “we”, “us” or “our” as the context may require) and its successors in interests and assigns. 

1.2 The natural or legal person who/which accepts these Terms and agrees to participate in the Symbol Project (as defined below) as set out in these Terms (“Participant”, “you” or “your” as the context may require). 
In these Terms, you and the Company are hereinafter collectively referred to as the “Parties” and each individually as a “Party” as the context may require. 
If you have any questions relating to these Terms, please contact us at symbolterms@nem.group. 


2. SYMBOL AND THE NEM COMMUNITY 

2.1 The NEM Community launched the version 1 NEM blockchain (“NIS1 Blockchain”) and the XEM token (“XEM”) in March 2015. Since that time, the NEM Community has determined that it would be desirable to develop a new blockchain, which has now been developed (the “Symbol Blockchain”). The Symbol Blockchain is expected to be launched in late 2020 along with the new XYM token which will be its native currency. 

2.2 The Proposal for the migration of token and data information from the NIS1 Blockchain to the Symbol Blockchain, along with the issue and allocation of XYM and a Tokenomics proposal1 (the “Proposal”), was considered and voted on by the NEM Community which voted in favour of the Proposal on 21 December 2019. 

2.3 These Terms apply to holders of an NIS1 Account, and holders of an NIS1 Multisig Account (jointly and severally), who opt-in (in accordance with clauses 6 and 7 of these Terms) to participate in the Symbol Project. 

2.4 For a more detailed description of the proposed Symbol Blockchain and Symbol Project, XYM, 
Migration and Tokenomics proposal, please refer to: 
(a) The NEM Website at www.nem.io (the “NEM Website”) and NEM Forum at https://forum.nem.io/ (“NEM Forum”) and such other websites and fora as may be specified from time to time on the NEM Website (b) The Migration Approach and Tokenomics Proposals dated December 2019 at 
https://forum.nem.io/t/catapult-migration-and-tokenomics-proposal-for-nem-community-poi- vote/24033 along with the documents referred to and hyperlinked therein (c) The “Symbol Technical Reference” (a copy of which can be found at: http://bit.ly/symbol- 
technical-reference (d) The “Symbol White Paper” (to be posted on: the NEM Forum and/or the NEM Website before 
Launch) (e) The detailed “Tokenomics Proposal” dated December 2019 (a copy of which can be found at 
http://bit.ly/tokenomics-proposal-dec2019 ) (f) The detailed “Public Chain Migration Recommendation” paper dated 30 October 2019 (a 
copy of which can be found at http://bit.ly/public-chain-migration-oct2019) (g) The API documentation for Symbol blockchain and ancillary software. http://bit.ly/symbol-api- 
documentation (h) The “NEM Forum” https://forum.nem.io (i) A post on the NEM Forum (forum.nem.io) outlining the launch documents, progress and process (the “Symbol Launch Single Source of Information”) https://forum.nem.io/t/symbol-launch-reporting-single-source-of-information/24863 
(collectively, the “Symbol Documentation”). 


3. Definitions & Interpretation 

3.1 Definitions 
Various definitions are set out in these Terms. Some definitions are set out below and others are contained in the relevant parts of these Terms. 

In these Terms, the following expressions shall have the following meanings: 

“NIS1 Account” means an NIS1 Single Account or NIS1 Multisig Account on the NIS1 Blockchain. 

“NIS1 Account Holder” means an NIS1 Single Account Holder or an NIS1 Multisig Account Holder. 

“NIS1 Multisig Account” means an NIS1 multi-signature account, which requires transactions to be electronically signed by the NIS1 Single Account Holders who are the co-signatories to the NIS1 Multisig Account. 

“NIS1 Multisig Account Holder” means, jointly and severally, the NIS1 Single Account Holders who are signatories for an NIS1 Multisig Account. 

“NIS1 Single Account” means an NIS1 Account which is not an NIS1 Multisig Account. 

“NIS1 Single Account Holder” means the person who controls the keys for the NIS1 Single Account. 


4. The Symbol Project 

4.1 The Symbol Project will involve the following key milestones as more particularly detailed in the Symbol Documentation (and documents linked to in the Symbol Documentation). The terms relating to the Symbol Project and each milestone set out below are subject to change in accordance with clause 23 below: 

(a) The “Opt-In”: NIS1 Account Holders who are eligible under clause 5 may “opt-in” to the Symbol Project in accordance with clauses 6 or 7 of these Terms. NIS1 Account Holders may “opt-in” to the Symbol Project before or after the Snapshot, up to a period of 6 years from the Launch (as defined below), with different processes applying in either case as set out in clauses 6 and 7 below. By sending an “opt-in” message from an NIS1 Account to a dedicated opt-in account in accordance with the requirements in clauses 6.2, 6.3 and 7.5.1, the NIS1 Account Holder confirms acceptance of these Terms, and confirms the NIS1 Account Holder(s) intention to participate in the Symbol Project in accordance with these Terms. 

(b) Extraction and Validation of data from the NIS1 Blockchain: Data from the NIS1 Blockchain will be extracted and validated in preparation for the launch of the Symbol Blockchain. The extracted data will include the balance of XEM held by each NIS1 Account, NIS1 Multisig Account configuration information, and (at the NIS1 Account Holders’ option) root Namespace ownership information (the “NIS1 Account Data”). The extraction and validation will occur at an NIS1 Blockchain “height” (a specific block number on the NIS1 

(c) The migration of the NIS1 Account Data from the NIS1 Blockchain to the Symbol Blockchain (the “Migration”). The Migration will occur via an ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) process using the NIS1 Account Data of NIS1 Accounts that have opted-in in accordance with clause 6 to populate the Genesis block of the Symbol Blockchain. Where it is not possible to put all allocation transactions in Block 0 (for example, because the volume of data is too great), these will be added to blocks immediately following Block 0 or as close as practicable to Block 0. NIS1 Account Holders who opt in in accordance with clause 7 will be subject to a different process for the Migration. 

(d) The Symbol Blockchain will be launched with a Genesis/Nemesis block created from the data referred to in clause 4.1(c) (the “Launch”). Initial configuration of the Symbol Blockchain will also implement the Tokenomics proposals contained in the Tokenomics Proposal as supplemented in the Symbol Documentation (the “Tokenomics”). 

(e) The allocation and distribution of XYM to holders of NIS1 Accounts that have “opted-in” to the 
Symbol Project. Each NIS1 Account that opts in in accordance with clause 6 and 7: 
(i) will have a new account set up on the Symbol Blockchain; and (ii) one XYM for each XEM that was held in the NIS1 Account will be allocated and distributed to 
the new account on the Symbol Blockchain. 

(f) Those NIS1 Accounts that have opted-in in accordance with clause 6 will have XYM allocated and distributed to them at the Launch (“Allocation”). For those NIS1 Account Holders that opt in after the Snapshot, a different process and additional terms will govern the Allocation as defined in clause 7. Those NIS1 Account Holders will have XYM allocated and distributed to them after the Launch at a time to be determined (“Post Launch Allocation”). A sufficient number of XYM tokens will be transferred at Launch to a trustee to be held in accordance with the terms of a declaration of trust (“Trust”) for the benefit of NIS1 Account Holders that are eligible to opt-in in accordance with clause 5 and who opt in in accordance with clause 7, but did not opt-in before the Snapshot in accordance with clause 6. The XYM in the Trust are referred to in these Terms as “Unclaimed XYM”. 

(g) The publication of the Symbol network node software and blockchain configuration to allow publicly created nodes to join the Symbol network in a decentralised way that no individual person or entity can or should control (the “Decentralisation”). 

4.2 References to the “Symbol Project” are references to the above milestones and a reference to 
“participating” in the Symbol Project means opting in to: 

(a) The migration of the NIS1 Account Data as part of the Migration; 

(b) being allocated and receiving distribution(s) of XYM in the Allocation and Post Launch Allocation; 
and 

(c) be bound by these Terms, including the Symbol Documentation, Tokenomics and Migration. 


5. Eligibility to participate in the Symbol Project 

5.1 To be eligible to opt in and participate in the Symbol Project, you must fulfil the requirements of clauses 5.2 and 5.3 below, and be an NIS1 Account Holder of an NIS1 Account that meets one or more of the criteria listed in 5.1(a) or (b) below as at the time of the Snapshot. An NIS1 Account is eligible if it is: 

(a) an NIS1 Account with a greater than 100 XEM balance; 

5.2 You must have control (either individually or jointly) of the private key(s) to the eligible NIS1 Account in order to opt in. If you do not have control of the keys associated with the relevant NIS1 Account, (for example, because you hold XEM through a third-party exchange), you will not be eligible to participate. In such a case, opt-in of the NIS1 Account will be dependent upon such third party. 

5.3 In the case of an NIS1 Multisig Account, every NIS1 Multisig Account Holder must have the cosignatory private keys associated with the eligible NIS1 Multisig Account in order to opt in that account. If the NIS1 Multisig Account Holders do not have control of, or access to, the cosignatory keys for the NIS1 Multisig Account, the account will not be eligible to participate unless those lost keys are replaced prior to performing the opt in. 


6. Steps required to participate in the Symbol Project prior to Snapshot 

6.1 To opt-in and participate in the Symbol Project prior to the Snapshot, NIS1 Account Holders must follow the “opt-in” instructions to be published on the Symbol Launch Single Source of Information prior to the Snapshot. 

6.2 There will be three ways to opt in: 

(a) by a plugin in the version of the NEM Nano desktop wallet communicated in the instructions to be published on the Symbol Launch Single Source of Information as provided for in clause 6.1 above, and available here https://nemplatform.com/wallets/; 

(b) by a mobile app which will be specifically developed to enable NIS1 Account Holders to opt in; or 

(c) by programmatically sending a transaction that mirrors the instructions sent by the methods in (a) or (b) above. The required code will be published on Github and a link provided on the Symbol Launch Single Source of Information. 

6.3 In the case of NIS1 Multisig Accounts, before the NIS1 Multisig Account will be opted-in to the Symbol 

Project, every NIS1 Multisig Account Holder must: 

(a) ensure their NIS1 Single Account (associated with the NIS1 Multisig Account) is opted in in accordance with clause 6.2 before opting-in the NIS1 Multisig Account. NIS1 Multisig Accounts with more than 8 cosigning NIS1 Multisig Account Holders will not be able to opt in. It is the responsibility of the NIS1 Multisig Account Holders jointly and severally to ensure that the NIS1 Multisig Account they wish to opt in has not more than 8 NIS1 Multisig Account Holders as cosigners before attempting to opt in in accordance with this clause 6. Any NIS1 Multisig Account Holders who have lost their keys and cannot sign should also be removed as cosigners from the NIS1 Multisig Account prior to opt in, as the NIS1 Multisig Account will not be able to opt in unless they are removed; 

(b) agree to being added to the new Symbol multi signature account as part of the opt in process in 
clause 6.2; and 

(c) digitally sign the “opt-in” transaction for the NIS1 Multisig Account in accordance with clause 6.2. 

6.4 Once an NIS1 Account has been successfully “opted-in” to the Symbol Project, it will: 

(a) be included in the Snapshot; 

(b) have the NIS1 Account Data associated with the NIS1 Account migrated to the Symbol 
Blockchain; 

(c) be eligible to be allocated XYM to a Symbol account in the Allocation; and 

(d) be eligible to participate in the Tokenomics from the time of the Launch. 


7. Steps required to participate in the Symbol Project for opt-in after Snapshot 

7.1 NIS1 Account Holders who are eligible in accordance with clause 5 to participate in the Symbol Project at the time of the Snapshot, but who fail to “opt-in” before the Snapshot, may opt in to participate in the Symbol Project and claim an allocation of XYM from the Unclaimed XYM in the Trust within 6 years of the Snapshot. The Unclaimed XYM which are not claimed by the end of such 6-year period will be burned. 

7.2 Rules for participating in the Symbol Project by opt-in after the Snapshot will be finalised and published on the Symbol Launch Single Source of Information (“Post Launch Participation Rules”). If you “opt in” after the Snapshot, you agree to be bound by these Terms and by the Post-Launch Participation Rules. 

7.3 An account which opts in after the Snapshot will not be allocated XYM, or have any NIS1 Account Data included in the Migration, at the Launch. The timing and process for the Post-Launch Allocation and Migration of NIS1 Account Data following Launch (“Post-Launch Migration”) to holders of NIS1 Accounts that opt-in after the Snapshot will be set out in the Post-Launch Participation Rules, or otherwise published on the Symbol Launch Single Source of Information. Neither the Company, nor any of the Company Indemnified Parties (as defined below), accept any responsibility for any loss or damage (whosoever caused) as a consequence of an NIS1 Account Holder opting-into the Symbol Project after Snapshot, including (but without limitation) losses as a result of: 

(a) the value of XYM falling between Launch and the time at which XYM is distributed under the Post-Launch Participation Rules; or 

(b) being unable to register a root Namespace due to someone else registering it on Symbol prior to 
post Launch Allocation occurring. 

7.4 Accounts that opt-in and participate in the Symbol Project in accordance with the Post-Launch Participation Rules will not be entitled to retrospective participation in the Symbol Project (and, in particular, the Tokenomics rules), and will not be entitled to any compensation for any losses as a result of the lapse in time between Launch and the time at which such NIS1 Accounts are allocated and distributed XYM and become participants in the Symbol Project. 


8. Withdrawal from Symbol Project 

8.1 Should the holder of an NIS1 Account wish to withdraw from the Symbol Project after opting in but prior to the Snapshot, the holder must transfer the XEM from the NIS1 Account that was “opted in” in accordance with clause 6 above to another NIS1 Account that has not been opted in, or in some other way cause themselves to cease to be a NIS1 account holder by the Snapshot (for example, by selling their XEM). 

8.2 NIS1 Accounts with nil balances of XEM may still migrate multisignature account set ups and/or 
Namespaces but will have no XYM allocated in the Allocation. 


9. XYM and XEM utility 

9.1 You acknowledge and accept that neither XYM or XEM represents or constitutes: 

(a) any ownership right or stake, share, equity, security, collective investment scheme, managed fund, financial derivative, futures contract, deposit, commercial paper, negotiable instrument, investment contract, note, commodity, bond, warrant, certificate debt or hybrid instrument or any other financial instrument or investment entitling the holder to interest, dividends or any kind or return or carrying equivalent rights (including in respect of the Company); 

(b) any right to receive future revenues, shares or any other form of participation or governance 
right from, in or relating to the Company; 

(c) any form of currency, money, deposit or legal tender, whether fiat or otherwise, in any jurisdiction, nor do they constitute any substitute or representation of currency, money, deposit or legal tender (including electronic money); or 

(d) right, title, interest or benefit whatsoever in whole or in part, in the Company or any assets 
related to it. 

9.2 Protections offered by applicable law in relation to the acquisition, storage, sale and/or transfer of the instruments and/or investments of the types referred to in the sub-clauses of clause 9.1 do not apply to the Allocation of XYM under these Terms or to your storage, sale and/or transfer of XYM or XEM. 


10. Participant’s representations and warranties 

10.1 By participating in Symbol Project, you hereby represent and warrant the matters set out in Schedule 1 of these Terms. 

10.2 You undertake and agree to notify the Company immediately if any of the representations and warranties set out in Schedule 1 of these Terms becomes untrue, incomplete, invalid or misleading in any respect. 

10.3 If you cannot make all of the representations and warranties set out in Schedule 1 of these Terms, you must not seek to opt in to participate in the Symbol Project. 


11. Risks 
11.1 You acknowledge and agree that participating in the Symbol Project may carry significant financial, regulatory and reputational risks, including but not limited to those set out in Schedule 2 of these Terms. 

11.2 By participating in the Symbol Project and accepting these Terms, you expressly and finally acknowledge, accept and assume the risks set out in Schedule 2 of these Terms and acknowledge, accept and assume that such risks are not nor are they intended to be a comprehensive or exhaustive list of risk factors. 


12. Security 

12.1 You are responsible for implementing all reasonable and appropriate measures for securing your opt- in to the Symbol Project, and to receive and store XYM (and other migrated data from the NIS1 Account and Blockchain) that are allocated to you in the Allocation, including any requisite private key(s) or other credentials necessary to access such storage mechanism(s). If your private key(s) or other access credentials are lost, you may lose access to your XYM and/or other data. The Company is not responsible for any security measures relating to your receipt, possession, storage, transfer or potential future use of XYM and Symbol Blockchain nor will we be under any obligation to recover or return any XYM and/or other data. 

12.2 The Company excludes (to the fullest extent permitted under applicable law) any and all liability for any security breaches or other acts or omissions which result in your loss of (including your loss of access to) XYM and/or other data issued to you. 

13. Indemnity 

13.1 To the fullest extent permitted by applicable law, you will indemnify, defend and hold harmless the Company and our respective past, present and future employees, officers, directors, contractors, consultants, equity holders, suppliers, vendors, service providers, parent companies, subsidiaries, associates, affiliates, agents, representatives, predecessors, successors and assigns, specifically including NEM.io Foundation Limited, NEM Studios Limited, NEM Ventures Limited, NEM Holdings Limited, NEM Trading Limited, NEM Software Limited, and Tech Bureau Holdings, the NEM Community Trust (and its trustees), the NEM Group Trust (and its trustees), other community member(s) and any other party who has committed code to the Open Source Github repositories for the Symbol Project (the “Company Indemnified Parties”), along with the Core Developers (being those individuals with the telegram handles/forum names “BloodyRookie”, “Gimre” or “Gimer”, and “Jaguar0625” or “Jaguar”) or the Core Team, from and against any and all claims, demands, actions, damages, losses, costs and expenses (including reasonable professional and legal fees) that arise from or relate to: 

(a) your acquisition and/or use of XYM and/or use of the Symbol Blockchain under these Terms; 

(b) the performance or non-performance of your responsibilities, representations, warranties or 
obligations under these Terms; 

(c) your breach of any of the terms and conditions set out in these Terms; or 

(d) your breach of any rights of any other person or entity in connection with these Terms. 

13.2 The Company reserves the right to exercise sole control over the defence, at your sole cost and 
expense, of any claim subject to an indemnity set out in clause 13.1. 

13.3 The indemnity set out in this clause 13 is in addition to, and not in lieu of, any other remedies that may be available to the Company under any applicable law. 


14. Disclaimers 

14.1 To the fullest extent permitted by applicable law and except as otherwise specified in writing by us: 

(a) participation in the Symbol Project is offered without any warranties or representations of any kind, and we expressly disclaim all warranties and representations relating to the Symbol Project and XYM (whether express or implied), including, without limitation, any implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, title and non-infringement; 

(b) we do not represent or warrant that XYM and/or Symbol Blockchain is reliable, current or defect- 
free, meet your requirements, or that any defects will be corrected; and 

(c) we cannot and do not represent or warrant that XYM or the distribution mechanism for XYM are 
free of viruses or other harmful components. 

14.2 Neither these Terms nor the Symbol Documentation constitute a prospectus or offering document, and are not an offer to sell, nor the solicitation of an offer to buy any investment or financial instrument in any jurisdiction. XYM should not be acquired for speculative or investment purposes with the expectation of making a profit on immediate or future re-sale. 

14.3 No regulatory authority has examined or approved any of the information set out in these Terms and/or the Symbol Documentation. No such action has been or will be taken under the laws, regulatory requirements or rules of any jurisdiction. The publication, distribution or dissemination of these Terms and/or the Symbol Documentation does not imply that applicable laws, regulatory requirements or rules have been complied with. 


15. Limitation of liability 

15.1 To the fullest extent permitted by applicable law, in no circumstances will: 

(a) the Company or any of the Company Indemnified Parties be liable for any direct, indirect, special, incidental or consequential loss of any kind (including, but not limited to, loss of revenue, income, business or profits, loss of contract or depletion of goodwill, loss of anticipated savings, loss of use or data, or damages for business interruption or any like loss) arising out of or in any way related to the acquisition, storage, transfer or use of XYM or otherwise related to these Terms, regardless of the cause of action, whether based in contract, tort (including negligence), breach of statutory duty, restitution or any other legal or equitable basis (even if the Company or any of the Company Indemnified Parties have been advised of the possibility of such losses and regardless of whether such losses were foreseeable); and 

(b) the aggregate liability of the Company and the Company Indemnified Parties (jointly), whether in contract, tort (including negligence), breach of statutory duty, restitution or any other legal or equitable basis, arising out of or relating to these Terms or the use of or inability to use XYM and/or Symbol Blockchain, exceed £1. 

15.2 The limitations and exclusions of liability set out in clause 15.1 do not limit or exclude liability for fraud or intentional, wilful or reckless misconduct of any Company Indemnified Party, nor will it limit or exclude any losses for which, as a matter of applicable law, it would be unlawful to limit or exclude liability. 


16. Assignment and novation 

16.1 The Company may assign, transfer, novate or otherwise deal in any manner, all or any part of the benefit of these Terms and any of its rights, remedies, powers, duties and obligations under these Terms to any person, without your consent and in any way the Company considers appropriate. 

16.2 You agree that you may not claim against any assignee, transferee or any other person who has an interest in these Terms, any right of set off or other rights that you have against the Company. 


17. Termination 

17.1 Notwithstanding any other provision of these Terms, the Company may at any time and for any reason immediately terminate these Terms as between you and it without prior notice or need to specify reasons, including if: 

(a) you have breached any provision of these Terms or acted in a manner which clearly shows that 
you do not intend to or are unable to comply with any provision in these Terms; 

(b) the Company reasonably considers it is required to do so by the application of any laws or regulations or by any government, quasi-government, authority or public body (including any regulatory body of any jurisdiction); or 

(c) the Company determines that performing its obligations under these Terms is no longer 
commercially viable. 


18. Survival 

18.1 The following clauses survive termination of these Terms and remain binding and effective at all times: 

(a) this clause 18; (c) clause 9 (XYM and XEM utility); (d) clause 10 (Participant’s representations and warranties); (f) clause 13 (Indemnity); (g) clause 15 (Limitation of liability); (h) clause 19 (Waiver of set-off); (i) clause 21 (Personal Data); and (j) clause 22 (Dispute resolution). 


19. Waiver of set-off 

19.1 You acknowledge and agree unconditionally and irrevocably to waive any right of set-off, netting, counterclaim, abatement or other similar remedy which you might otherwise have in respect of XYM and/or Symbol Blockchain or under these Terms under the laws of any jurisdiction. 


20. Taxation 

20.1 You are solely responsible for determining whether your participation in the Symbol Project and your receipt of your Allocation of XYM (and other migrated data) will give rise to any tax implications on your part. 

20.2 You are solely responsible for withholding, collecting, reporting, paying, settling and/or remitting any and all taxes to the appropriate tax authorities in such jurisdiction(s) in which you may be liable to pay tax. The Company is not responsible for withholding, collecting, reporting, paying, settling and/or remitting any taxes (including, but not limited to, any income, capital gains, sales, value added or similar tax) which may arise from your Allocation of XYM (and other migrated data) under or in connection with these Terms. 

20.3 You agree not to hold the Company or any of the Company Indemnified Parties liable for any tax liability associated with or arising from the creation, ownership, use or liquidation of XYM or any other action or transaction related to the Symbol Project. 


21. Personal Data 

21.1 The Company has a privacy policy set out herein in Schedule 3, which applies in relation to the Symbol 
Project. 


22. Dispute resolution 

22.1 Governing Law. These Terms and any dispute or claim (including non-contractual disputes or claims) arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the law of Gibraltar.  
22.2 Exclusive Jurisdiction. Each party irrevocably agrees that the courts of Gibraltar shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim (including non-contractual disputes or claims) arising out of or in connection with these Terms or their subject matter or formation. 

22.3 No Class Arbitrations, Class Actions or Representative Actions. Any dispute arising out of or related to these Terms is personal to you and the Company and will be resolved solely in accordance with clause 22.2, and will not be brought as a class arbitration, class action or any other type of representative proceeding. There will be no class arbitration or arbitration in which an individual attempts to resolve a dispute as a representative of another individual or group of individuals. Further, a dispute cannot be brought as a class or other type of representative action, whether within or outside of arbitration, or on behalf of any other individual or group of individuals. 

22.4 Severability of Dispute Resolution Provisions. If any term, clause or provision of this clause 22 is held invalid or unenforceable, it will be so held to the minimum extent applicable and required by law, and all other terms, clauses and provisions of this clause 22 will remain valid and enforceable. Further, the waivers set out in clause 22.3 above are severable from the other provisions of these Terms and will remain valid and enforceable, except as prohibited by applicable law. 


23. Miscellaneous 

23.1 We may amend these Terms from time to time (including, but not limited to, the terms of the Migration, the Allocation and the Tokenomics), including where there are changes to the intended utility of XYM, where adjustments are required to give effect to the intended operation of the Symbol Project, to make any essential corrections, or as may be otherwise required by any laws or regulatory requirements to which we are subject. If we make any amendments to these Terms, we will publish a notice together with the updated Terms on the Symbol Launch Single Source of Information on the NEM Forum (or such alternative website as is notified on the NEM Website from time to time) and we will change the “Version” number at the top of these Terms. Any amended Terms becomes effective immediately upon the publication of notice and updated Terms on the NEM Website. It is your responsibility to regularly check the NEM Website for any such notices and updated Terms. 

23.2 If any term, clause or provision of these Terms is found to be illegal, void or unenforceable (in whole or in part), then such term, clause or provision will be severable from these Terms without affecting the validity or enforceability of any remaining part of that term, clause or provision, or any other term, clause or provision of these Terms, which remains in full force and effect. 

23.3 These Terms constitute the entire agreement between the Parties in relation to its subject matter. These Terms replace and extinguish any and all prior agreements, draft agreements, arrangements, warranties, statements, assurances, representations and undertakings of any nature made by, or on behalf of the Parties, whether oral or written, public or private, in relation to that subject matter. 

23.4 You acknowledge that by accepting these Terms, you have not relied on any oral or written statements, warranties, assurances, representations or undertakings which were or may have been made by or on behalf of the Company, or by any other third party, in relation to the subject matter of these Terms at any time before your acceptance of them (“Pre-Contractual Statements”), other than those set out in these Terms. You hereby waive any and all rights and remedies which might otherwise be available in relation to such Pre-Contractual Statements. 

23.5 Nothing in these Terms creates any form of partnership, joint venture or any other similar relationship 
between you and the Company and/or other individuals or entities involved with the Symbol Project. 

23.6 You acknowledge and agree that no other Participant in the Symbol Project owes you any obligation 
under these Terms. 

23.7 Any indemnity, reimbursement or similar obligation in these Terms given in favour of the Company: 

(a) is a continuing obligation despite the satisfaction of any payment or other obligation in 
connection with this document, any settlement or any other thing; and 

(b) is independent of any other obligations under these Terms and continues after termination of them. It is not necessary for the Company to incur any expense or make payment before enforcing a right of indemnity in connection with the subject of these Terms. 

23.8 Without limiting any other disclaimer in these Terms or elsewhere, the Company is not liable for any loss, liability, costs or expenses arising in connection with the exercise or attempted exercise of, failure to exercise, or delay in exercising, a right, power or remedy in connection with these Terms. 

23.9 These Terms do not give rise to any rights for a third party to enforce any term of these Terms. The rights of the Parties to rescind or agree any amendment or waiver under these Terms are not subject to the consent of any other person. 

23.10 Force Majeure. The Parties shall not be liable for any failure or delay in performing any of their respective obligations under or pursuant to this Agreement, and any such failure or delay in performing its obligations will not constitute a breach of this Agreement, if such failure or delay is due to an ‘Act of God’, any change to the law, order or regulation of a governmental, supranational or regulatory body or any act of war or terrorism and it shall be entitled to a reasonable extension of the time for performance of such obligations as a result of such a cause. 


24. Interpretation 

(a) In these Terms, unless the context otherwise requires, words importing the singular shall be deemed to include the plural and vice versa, words importing the masculine gender shall include the feminine gender also and vice-versa, words importing the neuter gender shall include the masculine and feminine gender also and vice-versa. 

(b) Unless stated otherwise, references to an “Act” is a reference to a Gibraltar Act of Parliament 
(as may be amended from time to time). 

(c) References in these Terms to any statute or any statutory provision shall include any statute or statutory provision which now or at any time in the future, amends, extends, consolidates or replaces the same or which has been amended, extended, consolidated or replaced by the same and shall include any orders, regulations, instruments or other subordinate legislation made under the relevant statute. 

(d) The Schedules form part of these Terms and shall have effect as if set out in full in the body of 
these Terms. Any reference to these Terms includes the Schedules. 

(e) References in these Terms to any instrument or agreement shall include any instrument or 
agreement which at the date of these Terms varies, amends, extends or replaces the same. 

(f) Any words following the terms “including”, “include”, “in particular” or any similar expression shall be construed as illustrative and shall not limit the sense of the words preceding those terms. 

(g) A reference to any Party shall include that Party's personal representatives, successors, permitted transferees and permitted assigns and all references to a legal entity shall include their successors in interest, permitted transferees and permitted assigns. 

(h) References to "persons" includes natural persons, firms, partnerships, companies, corporations, associations, organisations, governments, states, governmental or state agencies, foundations and trusts (in each case whether or not incorporated or having separate legal personality and irrespective of the jurisdiction in or under the law of which it was incorporated or exists). 



SCHEDULE 1 

PARTICIPANT’S REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES 
By opting in to participate in the Symbol Project and accepting these Terms, you hereby represent and warrant that: 

1. You have read and understood these Terms (including all the Schedules hereto). 

2. You have the necessary authority and consent to accept these Terms, to enter into a binding 
agreement with the Company and to perform the obligations set out herein. 

3. You are not a statutory corporation, governmental or semi-governmental authority. 

4. The acceptance of these Terms and the entry into a binding agreement with the Company will not result in any breach of, be in conflict with, or constitute a material default under: (i) any provision of the Participant’s constitutional or organisational documents (in the case of a corporate entity including, without limitation, any company or partnership); (ii) any provision of any judgment, decree or order imposed on the Participant by any court or governmental or regulatory authority; and/or (iii) any material agreement, obligation, duty or commitment to which the Participant is a party or by which the Participant is bound. 

5. You have sufficient understanding of the functionality, usage, storage, transmission mechanisms and intricacies associated with cryptographic tokens, token storage facilities (including digital token wallets), blockchain technology and blockchain-based software systems. 

6. You have obtained sufficient information about the potential future utility of XYM and Symbol 
Blockchain to make an informed decision to participate in the Symbol Project. 
11. Participating in the Symbol Project and receiving XYM under these Terms is not unlawful or prohibited under the laws of your jurisdiction or under the laws of any other jurisdiction to which you may be subject and the receipt by you of your Allocation of XYM will be made in full compliance with applicable laws (including, but not limited to, in compliance with any tax obligations to which you may be subject in any relevant jurisdiction). 

12. You are not a resident or tax resident of, and do not otherwise have any relevant connection with, any jurisdiction in which entry into or performing your obligations under these Terms or the distribution, holding, use or exchange of XYM and/or Symbol Blockchain is unlawful or restricted in any way or requires licensing, registration or approval of any kind. 

20. You will comply with any applicable tax obligations in your jurisdiction arising from your acquisition, 
storage, sale or transfer of XYM. 

21. You enter into these Terms voluntarily and based on your own independent judgment and on advice 
from independent advisors as you have considered necessary. 

22. You understand and accept the risks of participating in blockchain start-up businesses and 
acknowledge that these risks are substantial. 



SCHEDULE 2 

RISK FACTORS 
THE FOLLOWING ARE NOT NOR ARE THEY INTENDED TO BE A COMPREHENSIVE OR EXHAUSTIVE LIST OF RISK FACTORS 

1. Risk of software weaknesses: The Symbol Blockchain is still in an early development stage and unproven. There is no warranty or assurance that the process for creating XYM will be uninterrupted or error-free and there is an inherent risk that the software could contain defects, weaknesses, vulnerabilities, viruses or bugs causing, inter alia, the complete loss of XYM and/or other data. In addition, the Symbol Blockchain and Symbol Network are based on open source development, and changes may occur to the Symbol Blockchain, Symbol Network and Tokenomics which are outside of the control of the Company or any of the Company Indemnified Parties. 

2. Regulatory risk: Blockchain technology allows new forms of interaction and it is possible that certain jurisdictions will apply existing regulations on, or introduce new regulations addressing, blockchain technology-based applications, which may be contrary to the current setup of the Symbol Project and which may, inter alia, result in substantial modifications to the Symbol Project, including its termination and the loss of XYM. It is not known what regulatory framework the proposed Symbol Project and associated activities will be subject to, the nature and obligations that will be imposed on the Company in order to comply with any such regulatory framework or when/if the Company will even be able to apply to be regulated, or successfully obtain the required licences so that it may lawfully carry out its proposed business activities. 

3. Risk of abandonment / lack of success / business failure: The creation and issue of XYM and the development of the Symbol Project may be abandoned, may suffer from lack of success and may suffer business failure for a number of reasons including but not limited to, lack of interest from the public, lack of funding, lack of commercial success or prospects (e.g. caused by competing projects). There is no assurance that you will receive any benefits through the Symbol Project or through the XYM that you hold. 

5. Risks associated with markets for XYM: If secondary trading of XYM is facilitated by third-party exchanges, such exchanges may be relatively new and subject to little or no regulatory oversight, making them more susceptible to fraud or manipulation. Furthermore, to the extent that any third party ascribes an external exchange value to XYM (e.g. as denominated in a crypto or fiat currency), such value may be extremely volatile and diminish to zero. If you acquire XYM as a form of investment on a speculative basis or otherwise, or for a financial purpose, with the expectation or desire that their inherent, intrinsic or cash-equivalent value may increase with time, you assume all risks associated with such speculation or actions, and any errors associated therewith, and accept that XYM are not offered by the Company or its affiliates on an investment basis. You further acknowledge that the Allocation of XYM you receive under these Terms will not be protected, guaranteed or reimbursed by any governmental, regulatory or other entity, and will not, for instance be guaranteed by the Gibraltar Deposit Guarantee Scheme, the Gibraltar Investor Compensation Scheme, and is unlikely to be protected by any equivalent scheme in a jurisdiction outside of Gibraltar. 

6. Risk of losing access to tokens due to loss of private key(s), custodial error or your error: You acknowledge, understand and accept that if your private key(s) or password gets lost or stolen, the obtained XYM and other data may be unrecoverable and permanently lost. In addition, any third party 

that gains access to your private key(s), including by gaining access to the login credentials relating to your wallet, may be able to misappropriate your XYM and other data. Any errors or malfunctions caused by or otherwise related to the digital wallet or vault you choose to receive and store XYM and/or other data, including your own failure to properly maintain or use such digital wallet or vault, may also result in the loss of your XYM and/or other data. 

7. Risk of theft and vulnerabilities: The Symbol Blockchain may be exposed to attacks by hackers or other individuals including, but not limited to, malware attacks, denial of service attacks, consensus- based attacks, Sybil attacks, smurfing and spoofing. Any such successful attacks could result in theft or loss of XYM and/or other data, adversely impacting the ability to develop the Symbol Project. You must take appropriate steps to satisfy yourself of the integrity and veracity of relevant websites, systems and communications. 

9. Risks arising from taxation: The tax characterization of XYM is uncertain. You must seek your own tax advice in connection with acquisition, storage, transfer and use of XYM, which may result in adverse tax consequences to you, including, without limitation, withholding taxes, transfer taxes, value added taxes, income taxes, capital taxes and similar taxes, levies, duties or other charges and tax reporting requirements. 

10. Unanticipated risks: Cryptographic tokens such as XYM are a new and untested technology. In addition to the risks set out in this Schedule 2, there are other risks associated with your acquisition, storage, transfer and use of XYM and/or Symbol Blockchain, including those that the Company may not be able to anticipate. Such risks may further materialise as unanticipated variations or combinations of the risks set out in this Schedule 2.

INTRO_slideTwo.text: 了解如何通过此应用选择加入 Symbol网络：nemplatform.com/symbol-migration

INTRO_slideThree.title: 智能区块链
INTRO_slideThree.text: Symbol插件支持智能合约和架构，因而是最稳定、最安全的区块链。

IMPORT_WALLET_OPTIONS_content: 通过输入24 个词的密码（助记词）或扫描二维码（QR），导入 Symbol钱包。请选择您的选项

ImportOptions.title: 导入钱包
ImportOptions.contentPlaceholder: 输入 24 个词的密码（助记词）或扫描二维码，导入 Symbol钱包。请选择您的选项

ShowQRCode.errorTitle: 不是有效的 Symbol二维码

GenerateBackup.title: 创建备份
GenerateBackup.description: 您可通过写下钱包的密码（助记词）并存储在一个安全的地方，从而创建一个钱包备份。然后您可再次导入您的钱包，但请记住，任何得知您密码的人也可以访问您以该密码创建的帐户，从而获取您的资金。或者，您也可以通过生成包含您密码的二维码来创建备份钱包。

ShowMnemonics.title: 助记词密码
ShowMnemonics.description: 请写下一个24个词的备份密码（助记词），并保存在安全的地方。这样您可随时恢复您的钱包。

VerifyMnemonics.title: 验证您的密码

ShowQRCode.title: 备份钱包
ShowQRCode.description: Symbol“纸钱包”包含用于恢复此账户(profile)中所有帐户(account)的信息。您必须将此文件放在安全的地方。任何能读取纸钱包文件的人都能够获取您的所有资金。
ShowQRCode.permissionMessage: Symbol钱包需要访问您的存储空间以保存您的助记词二维码。
ShowQRCode.walletMnemonicQrSaved: 钱包助记词二维码已保存到

About.title: 关于 Symbol
About.aboutTextPara_1: NEM集团有限公司由一支国际团队组成，在 IT、创业、商务流程、贸易、房地产和资产开发、国际管理和学术界都拥有丰富经验。NEM的宗旨是以NEM的区块链技术平台促进企业发展，由企业运营、为企业服务。NEM 团队提供一系列支持和宣教，从培训活动和服务提供商到生态系统的技术支持均有涉足。
About.aboutTextPara_2: 我们的领导团队由一批具有深厚技术积累、丰富经验的国际性多元化人才组成，具有独特的清晰严谨的领导方法，从而在各个地区、为各种商务、在各种层面造成越来越广泛的影响。

NodeSwitching.title: 请稍等
NodeSwitching.description: 我们正在切换您的节点。

error.restricted: 受限制的后台通知，您设备上的后台任务受到限制
error.denied: 后台通知被拒绝。请打开此应用程序的 "后台应用刷新 "

OptIn.DashboardModalDescription: 您可以用本账户从 NEM NIS1 将资金选择加入到 Symbol
OptIn.WelcomeDescription: 完成选择加入，即表示您有意参与到Symbol公共区块链发布之中。这将让您能申领相当于您XEM 账户在快照时的余额的 XYM 资金（NEM NIS1 区块链上您的 XEM 不会受到影响）。您还可以从第一个Symbol区块起重新注册您的 NEM NIS1 命名空间（如果有的话）。您还可以更改 XEM 帐户的余额，该帐户在快照时的余额将决定您能收到的 XYM 金额。
OptIn.StoppedDescription: 选择加入已完成。请您更新应用程序以获取最新消息
OptIn.NoAccountsImported: 您尚未导入 XEM 帐户。要开始，请导入一个XEM 帐户。
OptIn.SelectNISAccount: 请选择一个 XEM 帐户：
OptIn.CosignMultisigOptIn: 共同签名的多签名选择加入
OptIn.ConfigureAccount: 选择您想要选择加入的帐户
OptIn.EmptyAccountList: 未找到已导入的帐户。请用以下按钮导入 XEM 帐户。然后，您可通过从列表中选择一个多签名帐户，以选择加入它，或为之进行共同签署。
OptIn.AccountIsOptedIn: 此帐户已成功选择加入
OptIn.AccountIsOptedInMultisigList: 共同签署的多签名账户
OptIn.SelectMultisigAccountTitle: 选择多签名 XEM 帐户
OptIn.NoNISAccounts: 您尚未导入 XEM 帐户
OptIn.HowToMultisig: 此帐户是多签名账户的同签署者。您应先完成此帐户的"选择加入"，以解锁共同签名的多签名账户的选择加入。
OptIn.BalanceWarning: 只有快照期间在此帐户中的资金会在Symbol发布时打入Symbol帐户中。
OptIn.StartOptInDescription: 您将为常规的非多签名帐户启动选择加入过程。这样做之后，您将把命名空间选择加入到目标帐户。此过程涉及以下步骤：
OptIn.StartOptInStep1: 选择要选择加入的命名空间
OptIn.StartOptInStep2: 第 2 步：创建 Symbol帐户
OptIn.StartOptInStep3: 第 3 步：备份 Symbol帐户
OptIn.StartOptInStepFinal: 最终：查看并完成选择加入
OptIn.NamespacesOptInDescription: 现在，您可将 NEM NIS1 拥有的命名空间进行选择加入。这就在 Symbol区块链上为相同的命名空间提供了一个占位符。所选择的每个命名空间都会增加选择加入所需的费用。
OptIn.VrfOptInDescription: VRF 密钥让您的帐户可以收获区块奖励。如果您打算在Symbol发布后在您帐户中持有超过 10000 个 XYM，并希望在 Symbol区块链上进行收获，则需将 VRF 密钥添加到选择加入流程中。
OptIn.VrfOptInCheck: 包括用于收获的 VRF 密钥
OptIn.ReviewSymbolAccountTitle: 第 2 步：查看 Symbol帐户
OptIn.ReviewSymbolAccountDescription: 这是您的 Symbol帐户，唯有知道助记词才能恢复账户。请在安全的地方写入全部助记词，然后备份二维码。
OptIn.BackupSymbolAccountTitle: 第 3 步：备份 Symbol帐户
OptIn.FinishOptInDescription: 这是选择加入的最终数据。请仔细查看并点击"完成"以结束该过程。
OptIn.Understand1: 我已经备份了用于选择加入过程的助记词密码， 我已知道保存和备份助记词是我自己的责任
OptIn.Understand2: 我知道，只有快照时我XEM帐户中持有的XEM资金将在Symbol发布时打入我的XYM帐户里。我知道，从现在起到快照之时，我对我 XEM 帐户所做的任何更改都将在 Symbol发布时反映在我的 XYM 余额中。
OptIn.SummaryDescription: 您已完成正常的选择加入，这里是有关信息
OptIn.MultisigOptInDescription: 要启动多签名帐户的"选择加入"，其中一个共同签名帐户必须通过 Nano 钱包（桌面钱包）来启动。之后，您可在下面的下拉列表中找到此帐户，并签署"选择加入"。当所有共同签名人都签名后，多签名帐户的选择加入即可完成
OptIn.SelectMultisigAccount: 请选择要加入的多签名帐户
OptIn.OptInNotInitiated: 此多签名帐户的选择加入尚未启动。请用Nano钱包来启动
OptIn.EnterPasswordToDecryptQR: 输入密码以解密二维码
OptIn.PendingAnotherSignaturesStatus: 正在等待其他共同签名人的签名
OptIn.ImportErrorMultisigAccountNotAllowed: 多签名选择加入请求必须与共同签名者帐户一起发出
OptIn.ImportErrorWrongOptedInAccount: 该帐户已选择加入，但该 Symbol帐户不是此钱包中的帐户。请导入正确的 Symbol帐户或使用另一个 XEM 帐户私钥

sidebar.removeAccountText: 是否确实要从本地存储中移除帐户？
sidebar.hideAccountDescription: 是否确实要隐藏此帐户？这是助记种子帐户，你可以随时使用"添加帐户"按钮恢复它。不会损失任何资金。
sidebar.removeAccountDescription: 是否确实要从钱包中移除此帐户？这不是助记种子帐户。确保您拥有此帐户的私钥，否则您可能会失去访问权限和资金

settings.changeTestnetNode: 您将要选择一个测试网节点。此处完成的所有交易都不会反映在主网网络中。
settings.logoutConfirmDesc: 退出后，设备上的数据将被删除。在继续进行之前， 您应有一个备份
settings.logoutConfirm2Desc: 除非你有备份，否则将无法再次访问钱包。是否确实要继续？
settings.logoutConfirmCheck: 我已经备份了此账户(profile)中的所有帐户(account)

qr.warningMultipleMosaicTransfer: 转账交易QR 包含多个马赛克。目前，此应用程序支持每个交易只发送一个马赛克。

unsortedKeys.invalidPrivateKeyQROrPassword: 私钥 QR 或密码无效！
unsortedKeys.accountAddressQRInfo: 这是Symbol帐户地址 QR 码。帐户名称为："%{accountName}"。地址是："%{recipientAddress}"。请选择下面的一项操作。
unsortedKeys.invoiceTransactionQRInfo: 这是本交易（发票）QR码。是否要将 %{amount} (%{mosaicName})发送到"%{recipientAddress}"？
unsortedKeys.accountPKQRInfo: 这是帐户私钥 QR 代码。您可通过填写"添加帐户"表格将此帐户添加到钱包中。
